answers.answer: Crazy as it sounds it is all completely normal, the same thing happens to me and scared me too. It has a lot to do with the fact that our blood pressure and blood volume has increased so dramatically. Just like all other symptoms, this too will pass.
I hope so because I feel like I'm going to pass out and these headaches ain't no joke.  Tylenol don't even take the edge off :(
Plus this is my third and I have NEVER experienced this.
Yeah Tylenol doesn't help with me either, hopefully it will get easier on you. Just remember each pregnancy is different, hope you feel better soon!!

I have been feeling the same up to the point where I cant stand I have to sit because my legs feel like jelly im scared of actually fainting and hurting my baby I went to the hospital on thursday and they out it down to low blood pressure now they have to check me all the time and I have to eat regular and often so it would be worth getting checked out

Well try not to drink alots of fluids that have sugar or cafein , drink lots of water that maight help . Buy tylenol the normal not the extra one . Sometimes that makes you feel great . Wen i was prengnent from my 1 child that always happend to mi ,. I try those thing and it hellped me , hope you feel good . :)
I felt the dizziness yesterday while i was just sat down at work. It ***** but it's normal. I took a few deep breaths and made myself a cup of tea with sugar which helped
Lol, I'm only 12 weeks and I experience all of that. I believe it truly is normal.

I can't Seem to stomach ANYTHING other than water drinking wise, sweet stuff just isn't too appealing to me right now & I've never drank soda (burns my throat lol) but I know what im drinking isn't the problem. Or eating for that matter. Started eating really clean before pregnancy and droped 23 pounds in the first trimester and still haven't gained any Back n I'm 23 weeks now. Ughh ladies this stresses me OUT lol. I don't want to run to the hospital n seem all whiny or W/E but I'm feeling like I might have a blood pressure problem. I developed preeclampsia with my last 2 children so that is a definat possibility.  Maybe that's why I'm so nervous.
U haven't gained a single pound back of those 23? That doesn't seem right..

question: I'm 23 weeks and have been getting AWFUL headaches for the past couple weeks & really dizzy for the past couple days. I can just be sitting there with a headache & all the sudden things start spinning and I see spots. It's scary. I mentioned it to my DR the other day and she told me it was normal.  I don't see HOW this is normal. I'm miserable.  I've been drinking plenty of fluids and eating regularly. What could this be?
title: HELP!!!!  dizziness & headaches
